Description: KB Home, a California-based homebuilder formerly known as Kaufman and Broad, Inc., agreed to pay a $2 million civil penalty to settle charges that it violated the terms of a 1979 consent order concerning home repair warranties.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2005/08/kb-home-pay-2-million-penalty-alleged-violations-ftc-order

Description: Four of the nation's largest home builders agreed to pay civil penalties totaling $4.3 million to resolve alleged violations of the Clean Water Act.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/June/08-enrd-524.html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: The Department of Housing and Urban Development announced it reached a $3.2 million settlement with KB Home Mortgage Company in connection with a series of alleged violations of HUD requirements.
Info Source: https://archives.hud.gov/news/2005/pr05-093.cfm

Description: KB Home and three other home builders agreed to pay a total of $4.3 million to state AGs and the federal government to resolve Clean Water Act violations. The settlement was also announced by the U.S. Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-kb-home-0
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/June/08-enrd-524.html
Attorney General's Office Enters Multi-Million Dollar Settlement with KB Home, States News Service, February 11, 2016 (via Nexis).
